definition: to brave the rain
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
surname Mao
old variant of 冒[mao4]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]

sentences.english: I had to cycle home in the rain and came in looking like a downed rat.
sentences.chinese: 我只能冒雨骑车回家，进门的时候湿得像一只落汤鸡。

sentences.english: They play football in spite of the rain.
The monks then marched through the rain to another pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 随后，僧侣冒雨前进至另一个寺塔。

sentences.english: But the previous day, as rain fell, he had visited the site where Rosenberg was shot.
sentences.chinese: 但前一天，他冒雨查看了罗森博格遇害的地点。

sentences.english: Despite the wind and the rain, they plodded on until they reached the cottage.
sentences.chinese: 尽管顶风冒雨，他们仍艰难地走到那座农舍。

sentences.english: So together they drove througha pouring rain.
sentences.chinese: 于是他们一起冒雨开车启程。

sentences.english: They belted up the road in the rain.
Walk home in the rain in your business suit.
sentences.chinese: 穿着工作装冒雨步行回家。

sentences.english: He held his hot face to the rain, and walked on in a trance .
sentences.chinese: 他恍恍惚惚昂着滚烫的脸颊，冒雨走着。

sentences.english: I have to walk home in rain in consequence of that I forget to bring my umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记带雨伞，只好冒雨步行回家。

sentences.english: The other day, in the propaganda activity which bustled about, two person of even in spite of the rain mountaineering jogged.
sentences.chinese: 日前，在忙碌的宣传活动中，两人甚至冒雨登山跑步。

sentences.english: He walked home in the rain and was wet through.
sentences.chinese: 他冒雨步行回家，淋得浑身湿透。

sentences.english: Evening to the us, the rain holding an umbrella to the noodle shop to eat noodles.
sentences.chinese: 晚起的我们，撑着伞冒雨去面馆吃面。

sentences.english: I went out in the rain and got wet through.
sentences.chinese: 我冒雨出赴，结果被淋得湿透了。

sentences.english: I have walked out in rain --and back in rain.
sentences.chinese: 我冒雨出去，又冒雨回来。

sentences.english: I have walked out in rain --and back in rain.
sentences.chinese: 我冒雨出去，又冒雨回来。

definition: that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
heavy rain/CL:場|场[chang2]
torrents of rain (idiom)
pouring with rain/rain bucketing down
Heaven is not cooperating (idiom)/the weather is not favorable for the planned activity
to spare no effort
day after day/for several days running
downpour (idiom)
to take shelter from the rain
to receive news (of)
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to travel at double speed/to make all haste
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
along the way/the duration of a journey
at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
to travel day and night
